bibl.title: The Expressions ""To Annoy"" as Used in Alexandria and ""To Sit on a Donkey"".
bibl.note: P. Osl. Inv. 1460 (= S.B. VI, 9121) preserves a private letter sent by Heraklous to Pompeius. The expression 'to annoy me' seems to be an indication of the Alexandrian origin of the letter. New readings clarify details of the story.
bibl.seg: Nikos Litinas, The Expressions ""To Annoy"" as Used in Alexandria and ""To Sit on a Donkey"".

P. Osl. Inv. 1460 (= S.B. VI, 9121) preserves a private letter sent by Heraklous to Pompeius. The expression 'to annoy me' seems to be an indication of the Alexandrian origin of the letter. New readings clarify details of the story.
